items.label: Chapter 4 - The AI Brain with NVIDIA Isaac

chapters/chapter1.title: Chapter 1 - Foundations of Physical AI
chapters/chapter1.description: Welcome to the exciting world of Physical Artificial Intelligence (Physical AI)! In this chapter, we'll explore how artificial intelligence moves from abstract algorithms and digital systems to tangible, physical manifestations. We'll establish the fundamental concepts that distinguish Physical AI from traditional digital AI and introduce you to the fascinating realm of embodied intelligence.

chapters/chapter2.title: Chapter 2 - The Robotic Nervous System (ROS 2)
chapters/chapter2.description: In Chapter 1, we explored the fundamental concepts of Physical AI and embodied intelligence. Now we dive into the practical infrastructure that enables these concepts to come to life: the Robot Operating System 2, or ROS 2. Just as our biological nervous system coordinates our body's responses, ROS 2 serves as the nervous system for modern robots, orchestrating communication between sensors, actuators, and control systems.

chapters/chapter3.title: Chapter 3 - Digital Twins and Simulation
chapters/chapter3.description: Welcome to Chapter 3, where we explore how digital twins and simulation enable the safe, efficient, and iterative development of Physical AI systems. Just as architects create digital models before building physical structures, roboticists use digital twins and simulation to test and refine AI algorithms before deploying them on real robots.

chapters/chapter4.title: Chapter 4 - The AI Brain with NVIDIA Isaac
chapters/chapter4.description: Welcome to Chapter 4, where we explore how the "AI brain" powers humanoid robots. Just as the human brain coordinates thoughts, perceptions, and actions, the AI brain in a robot integrates perception, planning, and control to create intelligent behavior. This chapter introduces NVIDIA Isaac, a powerful platform that provides the computational foundation for these AI systems.

chapters/chapter5.title: Chapter 5 - Vision–Language–Action Systems
chapters/chapter5.description: Welcome to Chapter 5, where we explore how robots can understand and act upon natural language commands through the integration of vision, language, and action. This convergence of modalities represents a significant leap in making robots more intuitive and accessible to human users.

chapters/chapter5-summary.title: Chapter 5: Vision–Language–Action Systems - Implementation Summary
chapters/chapter5-summary.description: I have successfully implemented Chapter 5 of the AI-native textbook titled "Vision–Language–Action Systems" following all specified requirements. Here's what was completed:

chapters/chapter6.title: Chapter 6 - Capstone Project - Simulated Autonomous Humanoid Robot
chapters/chapter6.description: Welcome to the final chapter of this textbook, where we bring together all the concepts you've learned to create a complete, simulated autonomous humanoid robot system. This capstone project demonstrates how all the components of Physical AI work together in a cohesive system.

chapters/template.description: This is a template for textbook chapters.
